eci_restarter(7) Miscellaneous Information Manual eci_restarter(7)

NAME

eci_restarter - eComInit restarter conventions

DESCRIPTION

Instances in an eComInit system each belong to a restarter, by default this is the default restarter which is part of svc.startd(8). The restarter's job is to control the managed instances which have been delegated to it, and to report on the status of these as well as any unmanaged resources which it tracks. Each restarter is free to interpret the properties of instances which have been delegated to it, so semantics varies between restarters, but a particular set of properties and reporting conventions is common to them all, and is described below.

INSTANCE DEFINITION

PROPERTIES

restarter sri nullable

Name of the delegated restarter for this instance. If set to null then the instance is not restarted, but is simply consdiered online so long as all its dependencies are up. This is not regarded as an unmanaged instance, thus it is perfectly possible to invoke administrative requests upon it. Any properties marked managed-only, however, are unlikely to be of any use.

startLimitBurst integer managed-only

Maximum number of start-attempts that may be made within startLimitIntervalSec seconds. When this number is reached, the instance is transitioned to the Maintenance state.

startLimitIntervalSec integer managed-only

See above.

INSTANCE REPORTING

state enumerated string
Instance state. See ecominit(5) for a description of the states.
2021-02-11
